translation:
Most Illustrious Sir

I have received Your Lordship’s official letter No. 28, in response to my letter of the 26th of last month, and regarding its content I must say that I am even more convinced that Your Lordship Your Lordship Your Lordship ad hoc to preside over an electoral table; furthermore, Your Lordship Your Lordship February 10th in which Your Lordship

From the attached copy Your Lordship will see Your Lordship Your Lordship Your Lordship

May God preserve Your Lordship São Lourenço, March 1st, 1840. Most Illustrious Sir Inácio José de Oliveira Guimarães. Chief of Police of Boqueirão. Joaquim Francisco dos Santos Abreu.

Follows with all possible speed.

Official letter from the President of the Primary Election Table of March 1st; received on the 2nd and replied on the same day. Secretariat of the Presidency of the Republic

To citizen Inácio José de Oliveira Guimarães, Chief of Police of Boqueirão. From the President of the Primary Table.
